content.text: Hi, I'm a convenience store manager. I like country music, and I met Taylor Swift. I drive a Nissan Pathfinder.
Hi, I'm 100 years old, very strong, feel like I might live forever, remember when nobody had TV, and I love to drink wine and dance in the moonlight.
Wow, you're 100 years old? That's amazing! I'm so glad to meet you!
Thank you. I'm glad to meet you too.
I'm interested in what your life was like when you were younger. Did you have a TV when you were growing up?
No, we didn't have a TV when I was growing up. We didn't even have electricity. We used kerosene lamps to light our homes.
That must have been hard.
It was, but it was also a lot of fun. We had to use our imaginations to create entertainment. We would play games, tell stories, and sing songs.
That sounds like it was a lot of fun.
It was. I miss those days sometimes.
I can see why. It sounds like you had a great childhood.
I did. I'm very grateful for my childhood.
I'm glad to hear that.
So, what's it like being a convenience store manager?
It's a lot of work, but it's also a lot of fun. I get to meet a lot of interesting people.
That sounds like it can be a lot of fun.
It can. I also get to listen to a lot of country music.
That's great! I love country music.
Me too. It's my favorite kind of music.
So, do you have any plans for the future?
I'm not sure yet. I'm still thinking about it.
Well, I'm sure you'll figure something out.
Thanks. I appreciate the vote of confidence.
You're welcome.
